clinical_study.brief_title: Vaccination Impact Against Pneumococcal Disease on Acute Otitis Media Morbidity in Colombian Children < 5 Years of Age
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Vaccination Against Pneumococcal Disease on the Morbidity of Acute Otitis Media in Colombian Children < 5 Years of Age

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to provide data on trends of morbidity due to Acute Otitis Media (AOM) (primary analysis) and morbidity and mortality due to pneumonia, and AOM related health care resources before and after the introduction of vaccination against pneumococcal disease within the Universal Mass Vaccination (UMV) in Colombia.

primary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of reported cases of AOM in children below 5 years of age, in post-vaccination period compared to pre-vaccination period of PCV vaccination in UMV
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 7 years : from January 2008 to December 2014

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of reported cases of AOM in children by morbidity, age group, and department in children in post-vaccination period compared to pre-vaccination period of PCV vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 7 years : from January 2008 to December 2014
secondary_outcome.description: Morbidity including hospitalization, outpatient visits and ICD-10 code type, age groups including 0-24 months and 25-59 months strata.

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of reported cases of pneumonia and acute respiratory infections, overall and by morbidity, age groups, and department in children below 5 years of age before and after implementation of PCV vaccination into the UMV
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 7 years : from January 2008 to December 2014
secondary_outcome.description: morbidity including hospitalization, outpatient visits and ICD-10 code type, age groups including 0-24 months and 25-59 months strata

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of reported deaths due to pneumonia and acute respiratory infections by age group (0-24 months and 25-59 months), department and overall in children below 5 years of age before and after implementation of PCV vaccination into the UMV
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 7 years : from January 2008 to December 2014

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of AOM related health care resources used and costs* before and after implementation of PCV vaccination into UMV by age group (0-24 months and 25-59 months) and overall
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 7 years : from January 2008 to December 2014
secondary_outcome.description: * Cost calculation (e.g. medical procedures** , physician visits [outpatient/inpatient and length of stay]) will be extracted from Medical Procedure Cost Manual from the MOH for this analysis: http://www.fasecolda.com/index.php/ramos/soat/tarifas-y-coberturas/manual-tarifario-de-salud/. ** Tympanostomies/myringotomies, myringotomies with insertion of ventilation tubes, etc.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total number of doses (complete or partial) of PCV vaccination administered in infants <1year of age after its introduction into the UMV program in Colombia.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 7 years : from January 2008 to December 2014

arm_group.description: The Total population will include all subjects included in the study. Only aggregated information will be collected for these subjects.

intervention.description: Data will be collected retrospectively for cases identified through RIPS*/ DANE** from 2008 until 2014 and through PAI*** from 2009 until 2014. *Registro Individual de Prestación de Servicios de Salud (RIPS) database (Health Service Provider Individual Registration Database), Columbia. **Departamento Administrativo Nacional de Estadística (DANE) database (The National Administrative Department of Statistics database), Columbia. ***Programa Ampliado de Immunizaciones (PAI) database (National Immunization Program database), Columbia.

study_pop.textblock: All eligible subjects (aggregated) captured by the selected national databases in Columbia.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children aged less than five years with record of acute otitis media (with ICD-10 codes: H65 to H66) AND/OR.
- Children aged less than five years with record of pneumonia (with ICD-10 codes: J13 to J18) AND/OR.
- Children aged less than five years with any ICD-10 codes for respiratory diseases (J00-J99).
Exclusion Criteria:
• Not applicable
